measured_by: self-rated 0–100 sliding scale of ability to remember events similar to the case
justification: "Subjects rated their ability to remember events similar to the presented case (i.e. episodic memory)…" (Measures section).

measured_by: self-rated 0–100 sliding scale of knowledge about similar cases
justification: "…how knowledgeable they were concerning similar cases (i.e. semantic memory)…" (Measures section).

measured_by: self-rated 0–100 sliding scale of how realistic the case seemed
justification: "…and how realistic they believed the case to be (i.e. perceived realism)." (Measures section).

measured_by: self-rated 0–100 sliding scale of case strength
justification: "Subjects were specifically asked to rate the strength of the case…" (Measures section).

measured_by: binary choice (guilty vs not guilty beyond a reasonable doubt)
justification: "…they were asked to indicate if they found the accused party to be guilty or not guilty beyond a reasonable doubt." (Measures section).
